name: isnvc
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, cnvc), wa(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clvec)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cnvc), wa(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clvec)))
-| wceq(cnvc, cin(cnlm, clvec))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmVec ↔(c0 ∈ NrmMod ∧ c0 ∈ LVec))
⊣ NrmVec =(NrmMod ⋂ LVec)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cnvc), wa(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clvec)))
-| wceq(cnvc, cin(cnlm, clvec))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmVec ↔(c0 ∈ NrmMod ∧ c0 ∈ LVec))
⊣ NrmVec =(NrmMod ⋂ LVec)

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wcel(c0, cnvc), wa(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clvec)))

comment: A normed vector space is just a normed module which is algebraically a vector space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
